predictions.text: Eurostat will report euro area (EA20) HICP flash inflation (YoY) for November 2025 between 2.4% and 2.9%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Eurostat flash HICP YoY for the euro area as published in the official press release and database (e.g., prc_hicp_manr). Outcome must fall within [2.4%, 2.9%].
evidence: Energy prices have been soft, lowering headline inflation.
Core disinflation is gradual; services remain sticky but easing.
Market consensus and recent country prints point near the high-2% range.
monitoring_signals: Preliminary national CPI prints (DE, ES, FR, IT)
Brent crude and natural gas prices
ECB commentary and surveys (SPF) on inflation expectations
predictions.rationale: Energy-driven base effects and gradual core disinflation keep headline in the high-2s.

predictions.text: China NBS Manufacturing PMI for November 2025 will print between 49.6 and 50.4.
predictions.verification_criteria: Official NBS release for November 2025 Manufacturing PMI. Accept if headline PMI is within [49.6, 50.4].
evidence: Incremental policy support and improved export orders.
Recent Caixin PMI readings hovering near 50.
Electricity output and rail freight suggest stabilization, not robust expansion.
monitoring_signals: Caixin Manufacturing PMI
Export orders subindex in NBS PMI
High-frequency indicators (steel output, property sales)
predictions.rationale: Stabilization around the 50 line amid modest policy support and mixed external demand.

predictions.text: NOAA SWPC will issue at least one G3 (Strong) geomagnetic storm Watch or Warning by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: NOAA SWPC official alerts/watches archive must show a G3 Watch or G3 Warning issued within the window.
evidence: Solar Cycle 25 is near peak, increasing severe storm probability.
Recent superstorm activity highlights elevated space weather risk.
Multiple complex active regions observed recently.
monitoring_signals: SWPC sunspot/flare activity (M/X-class flares)
CMEs observed by SOHO/SDO
Kp index forecasts and WSA–ENLIL model outputs
predictions.rationale: Solar maximum conditions raise odds of strong geomagnetic activity this month.

predictions.text: Google will publish a Chrome Stable Channel update noting at least one CVE as "exploited in the wild" by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Chrome Releases blog post explicitly states "Google is aware that an exploit for [CVE] exists in the wild" for a Stable Channel update in the window.
evidence: Chrome has disclosed numerous zero-days each year (2023–2025 trend).
Rising cybercrime losses and exploit markets.
Holiday periods often see active exploitation cycles.
monitoring_signals: Chrome Releases blog and CVE entries
Threat intel reports on in-the-wild exploits
CISA KEV catalog additions referencing Chrome
predictions.rationale: Historical cadence of Chrome zero-days and active exploit markets support non-trivial odds.

predictions.text: PJM will issue at least one Cold Weather Alert between 2025-12-01 and 2025-12-31 (Eastern Time).
predictions.verification_criteria: PJM Operations/Newsroom posts or official operator messages indicating a 'Cold Weather Alert' within the specified dates.
evidence: Early winter cold snaps are common in December.
Forecasts show risk of below-normal temperatures in parts of PJM.
PJM routinely issues preparedness alerts in cold outbreaks.
monitoring_signals: NOAA CPC 6–14 day temperature outlooks
PJM public dispatch/notifications page
Natural gas spot prices and regional basis
predictions.rationale: Seasonal climatology and forecast signals imply at least one preparedness alert is plausible.

predictions.text: EUR/USD spot will trade at or above 1.1100 on at least one UTC day by 2025-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Any reputable FX data source showing intraday high for EUR/USD >= 1.1100 on a UTC date within the window.
evidence: Revived Fed rate-cut expectations pressure the USD.
Euro area data stabilizing from lows improves EUR support.
Correlation with risk-on sentiment into year-end.
monitoring_signals: DXY index and U.S.–EU rate differentials (2Y)
ECB and Fed communications; OIS-implied cuts
Eurozone flash HICP and PMIs
predictions.rationale: Narrowing rate differentials and risk-on support a test of 1.11.

predictions.text: The U.S. 10-Year breakeven inflation rate (FRED: T10YIE) will close at or below 2.20% on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FRED series T10YIE daily close value <= 2.20% on a trading day within the window.
evidence: Oil and gasoline prices have eased, trimming near-term inflation expectations.
Growth concerns and disinflation trends cap breakevens.
Inflation swaps indicate contained medium-term expectations.
monitoring_signals: Brent/WTI prices and gasoline spreads
5Y5Y inflation swaps and TIPS flows
Key U.S. inflation prints (CPI, PCE), ISM prices paid
predictions.rationale: Energy softness and slowing demand can push breakevens toward 2.2%.

predictions.text: The U.S. 5-Year Treasury yield (FRED: DGS5) will close at or below 4.10% on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FRED series DGS5 daily close <= 4.10% on any trading day within the window.
evidence: Market pricing implies increased odds of 2026 rate cuts.
Declining term premium and softer data favor lower yields.
MOVE index has been trending lower on calmer rates volatility.
monitoring_signals: Fed communications and OIS path
ISM/PMI, payrolls, and retail sales surprises
MOVE index and Treasury auction demand
predictions.rationale: Cut expectations and softer data can pull the belly of the curve down.

predictions.text: ICE Endex EUA front-month futures will settle at or above €70.00 per tonne on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: ICE Endex official settlement price for the EUA front-month contract >= €70.00/tonne within the window.
evidence: EU ETS structural support and compliance demand into year-end.
Colder weather boosts power-sector allowance needs.
Prices have rebounded from lows, showing positive momentum potential.
monitoring_signals: ICE EUA futures price and open interest
EU power and gas prices, temperature forecasts
Policy headlines affecting EU ETS supply/demand
predictions.rationale: Seasonal compliance and colder weather can lift EUA prices to €70.

predictions.text: U.S. TSA airport checkpoint throughput will reach at least 2,800,000 passengers on at least one U.S. calendar day between 2025-12-20 and 2025-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: TSA daily checkpoint travel numbers posted on tsa.gov show a day in the window with total passengers >= 2,800,000.
evidence: Thanksgiving volumes approached or exceeded prior records.
Airlines report high load factors into the holidays.
Christmas/New Year travel typically produces multiple peak days.
monitoring_signals: TSA daily throughput updates
Airline capacity (seats, ASMs) and on-time performance
Severe weather disruptions that could depress traffic
predictions.rationale: Strong holiday travel demand suggests at least one 2.8M+ day.

predictions.text: S&P 500 Index (SPX) will close at a new all-time high on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Official SPX closing level exceeds its prior all-time closing high as tracked by S&P Dow Jones Indices on a trading day within the window.
evidence: Rate-cut hopes support equity valuations.
Seasonal tailwinds (year-end rally) often aid risk assets.
Mega-cap tech leadership remains intact despite breadth concerns.
monitoring_signals: Fed expectations via futures/OIS
Market breadth, advance-decline, and equal-weight vs. cap-weight
Earnings preannouncements and guidance from large caps
predictions.rationale: Supportive rates backdrop and year-end flows can nudge SPX to new highs.

predictions.text: Seasonally adjusted U.S. Initial Jobless Claims will print at or above 240,000 in at least one Weekly Claims report released by 2025-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: U.S. DOL Weekly Unemployment Insurance Weekly Claims News Release shows initial claims (seasonally adjusted) >= 240,000 in any release within the window.
evidence: Continuing claims have drifted higher, signaling softer labor demand.
Seasonal layoffs in early December can lift initial claims.
Mixed hiring trends in retail/transport post-holiday peaks.
monitoring_signals: DOL weekly initial and continuing claims
Challenger layoff announcements
High-frequency job postings (Indeed, LinkUp)
predictions.rationale: Seasonality and cooling labor demand raise odds of a 240k print.
